on 12/28/00 9:09 PM, Mathieu Gervais at egoine_@... wrote:

>> (though it is in a JAR file...if that makes a difference).
> It does. The reloading class loader of Junit is not (yet) able to load
> classes in jar files. That's probably your problem.
> Please try reading junit 3.4 release notes to see how to disable the
> reloading class loader.

Actually, reloading from Jar files is one of the new features in JUnit 3.4.

The reloading can be disabled, though, through use of a properties file, as
described in the release notes.

---
Ben Schroeder

subject: Re: [junit] Re: Problems going from JUnit 3.2 to 3.4
